description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Katie Pumphrey, who recently completed a goal to swim across the Chesapeake Bay.
title: This ultra-distance swimmer became the first to take 24-mile route up Chesapeake Bay

description: A program that turns science and math majors into teachers is effective in keeping graduates in the profession, but the need for STEM teachers far outweighs the number of educators it's bringing in.
title: This program is trying to lure Science and Math majors into becoming teachers.

description: A group of Jewish women is challenging Kentucky’s near-total abortion ban, saying it violates their religious beliefs. Similar lawsuits are advancing in Indiana and Missouri.
title: 3 women say Kentucky’s abortion laws are at odds with their Jewish faith in lawsuit

description:
The day after a debate in which he faltered many times, President Joe Biden hit the campaign trail to try and reassure supporters that he is still up for the job and capable of beating former President Donald Trump in November.

His performance in the CNN debate on Thursday led many Democrats to panic about his chances of winning reelection. Some commentators who have long supported Biden even called for him to step aside.

NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with NPR Senior White House Correspondent Tamara Keith and Congressional Correspondent Deirdre Walsh about what happens next and whether Biden can quell Democrats' fears.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.
title: Biden tries to reassure voters after a shaky debate performance

description: The Supreme Court has narrowed the Justice Department's use of an obstruction law to prosecute people who rioted at the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021.
title: Supreme Court limits a legal tool the DOJ has used to prosecute Jan. 6 defendants

description: LeBron James Sr. is giving his son, Bronny, a leg up in basketball.
title: Bronny James, LeBron's son, could make NBA history

description: With the presidential election just four months away, Democrats are still grappling with the question of whether Biden should even stay in the race after his fumbles at the presidential debate.
title: Biden’s less than stellar debate performance has the Democratic party concerned

description: The rural lifestyle retailer, with stores in 49 states, says it will withdraw its carbon emissions goals, cut its DEI roles and stop sponsoring Pride events after an online outcry from conservatives.
title: Tractor Supply slashes its DEI and climate goals after a right-wing pressure campaign

description: The president called surprise legislative elections, in two rounds on Sunday and July 7, and they're shaping up to be among the country's most divisive in recent history.
title: What to know about France's high-stakes election, where the far right is gaining ground

description: President Biden's feeble Thursday night debate performance in Atlanta highlighted concerns about his age that were not on display at a Friday rally in North Carolina.
title: Biden bounces back from bad debate with energetic Raleigh rally

description: Independent candidate RFK Jr. spoke to All Things Considered about the Biden-Trump debate and what it means for his third-party run for the presidency
title: RFK calls Biden-Trump debate 'sad,' sees political opening

description: In the wake of Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine, the U.S. and many western governments sought to isolate Russia politically and economically through sanctions. But Russia insists it still has plenty of friends in the world. Our Moscow correspondent went to meet some of them at an economic forum in Saint Petersburg.
title: Russia's New Friends

description: Former Trump White House aide Steve Bannon reported to a federal prison in Connecticut today to serve time after refusing to comply with a congressional investigation into the U.S. Capitol riot.
title: Supreme Court denies Steve Bannon's plea to stay free while he appeals

description: Two new studies estimate psychedelic use in the U.S. and both find magic mushrooms gaining in popularity, including some folks who just want to get a little bit high, aka microdosing.
title: Microdosing and tripping on mushrooms is on the rise in U.S.

description: The decision is a win for Western cities that wanted more powers to manage record homelessness. But advocates for the unhoused say the decision will do nothing to solve the larger problem
title: U.S. Supreme Court says cities can punish people for sleeping in public places

description: The court ruled that a state law with the ban can take effect, replacing the 22-weeks allowed currently
title: Iowa supreme court upholds ban on abortion at six weeks of pregnancy

description: In the first debate of the 2024 presidential race, Biden struggles to find his voice and Trump struggles with the truth. Plus, here's what to do this weekend.
title: Biden struggled, Trump lied. Debate takeaways, plus what to do this weekend

description: Four Black women at Harvard have been accused of plagiarism by right-wing activists. We examine the motivations behind the charges.
title: Black women at Harvard accused of plagiarism to attack DEI programs, supporter says

description: New York may soon be the largest district in the U.S. to ban phones from the classroom. “They’re not just a distraction, kids are fully addicted now to phones," says the city's schools chancellor.
title: New York City is moving to ban phones from school. Will it work?

description: The decision on abortion that the Supreme Court handed down Thursday was narrow. But confusion for doctors in abortion ban states about how to deal with pregnancy emergencies remains widespread.
title: Abortion bans still leave a 'gray area' for doctors after Idaho Supreme Court case

description: The spacecraft experienced numerous leaks and technical glitches. NASA says it's using the extra time to evaluate whether it can return safely.
title: Boeing's new spacecraft is forced to extend its stay at the International Space Station

description: President Biden and former President Trump took questions from CNN moderators for 90 minutes. Biden started out hard to follow. Trump confidently made assertions that were often factually wrong.
title: Biden and Trump point out during debate why the other's presidency failed

description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is set to move ahead with a long-stalled rule to protect borrowers from repeated attempts to collect loan payments from bank accounts with insufficient funds.
title: A watchdog group targets payday lenders with a ‘2 strikes’ rule to help borrowers

description: Immigration is playing a big role in the 2024 election and was featured in Thursday night's presidential debate on CNN. NPR looks at the facts behind the candidates' claims.
title: Fact check: What did Biden and Trump claim about immigration in the debate?

description: In other news, a weird monolith showed up outside Las Vegas, a star athlete was disappointed and a celebrity had a tough week.
title: Is your dog ugly? Find out in this week's news quiz

description: Immigration, abortion and the economy were among the election-year questions the candidates were asked in the 90-minute CNN Presidential Debate. Here are a few of the issues that took center stage.
title: What to know about the key policies that got airtime in the presidential debate

description: Israel and Egypt agreed to allow nearly 20 critically ill children to leave Gaza. This is the first major evacuation since the Rafah border closed last month.
title: Sick children are allowed to leave Gaza for the first time in weeks

description: How did prison phone calls get to be so expensive? The team from The Indicator from Planet Money explains.
title: 'Planet Money': The movement to make prison phone calls free

description: Gen Z is widely considered by pollsters to be a target constituency for both the Biden and Trump campaigns. We'll hear from two voices representing the voting group -- but from different sides.
title: How did the presidential debate reverberate with members of Gen X?

description: A Supreme Court decision striking down a bankruptcy deal also lifts a shield against lawsuits over the harms caused by the highly addictive opioid Oxycontin.
title: Controversial Purdue Pharma bankruptcy deal is rejected by the Supreme Court

description: A federal jury in California has ordered the NFL to pay $4.7 billion in damages for antitrust violations, a decision that could reshape the league's streaming model.
title: NFL must pay billions in damages in 'Sunday Ticket' case for violating antitrust laws

description: Democratic Rep. Robert Garcia of California speaks with NPR's Leila Fadel about President Biden's debate performance, which raised deep concerns among many Democrats.
title: Many Democrats are concerned by President Biden's debate performance

description: Oklahoma's top education official says public schools have to incorporate the Bible into their curriculum as a historical text. Many teachers and others are balking, saying he has no authority.
title: Oklahoma state superintendent says schools must assimilate the Bible into curriculum
